Description: A jar-stopper of marlware pottery. The dull beige fabric contains much sand and coarse grit. The lower part consists of a deep, rounded boss to fit a vessel. At the top the sides widen to a projecting flange and the convex top is marked with two recessed bands which cross at the centre.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, Findspot 60, on the North-west Ptolemaic mound
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 64, 66, 67 § 61, pl. xxxvi, 85, 85a)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.40, p.45, p.110-111, p.223, pl.65)
